intro: Mediolobivia aureiflora subvar. lilacinostoma, commonly known as the lilac-stemmed goldenflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its vibrant golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, contrasting beautifully with its deep lilac-colored stems. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, enhancing its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly sought after by botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
